{{also|Aber|åber}} ==Aragonese== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|an|la|habēre}}, present active infinitive of {{m|la|habeō||hold, have}}. ===Verb=== {{head|an|verb}} # to [[have]] ---- ==Breton== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|br|cel-bry-pro|*aber}}, from {{inh|br|cel-pro|*adberos}}. Cognate with {{cog|kw|aber||confluence, estuary}}, {{cog|owl|aper||confluence, estuary}}, {{cog|sga|abor||estuary}}. ===Noun=== {{head|br|noun|g=m|g2=f|plural|aberioù|}} # [[ria]], [[estuary]], [[mouth]] of a [[river]] ===Verb=== {{head|br|verb form}} # {{present tense of|br|aberiñ}} ===References=== * {{R:LEBM|aber}} ---- ==Cebuano== ===Etymology=== {{calque|ceb|es|a ver}}, short form of the phrase {{m|es|vamos a ver||let's see}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{hyphenation|ceb|a|ber}} ===Interjection=== {{head|ceb|interjection}} # {{n-g|[[let me see]]; [[let's see]]}} ---- ==Danish== ===Noun=== {{head|da|noun form|g=c}} # {{indefinite plural of|da|abe}} ===Verb=== {{head|da|verb form}} # {{present tense of|da|abe}} ---- ==French== ===Etymology=== Borrowed from {{bor|fr|br|aber}}. ===Noun=== {{fr-noun|m}} # {{lb|fr|geography}} A [[ria]], especially one in [[Brittany]]. ===Further reading=== * {{R:TLFi}} ---- ==German== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|de|gmh|aber}}, {{m|gmh|aver}}, from {{inh|de|goh|aber}}, {{m|goh|abur}}, {{m|goh|aver}}, {{m|goh|avur}}, {{m|goh|afur}}, from {{inh|de|gem-pro|*aferą||behind}}. Compare {{cog|lb|awer||but}}, {{cog|stq|oaber||but}}, {{cog|gml|āver}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/ˈaːbɐ/}} {{q|standard}} * {{IPA|de|/ˈabɐ/}} {{q|colloquial; when unstressed by regular shortening, but also used when stressed}} * {{audio|de|De-at-aber.ogg|audio (Austria)}} * {{audio|de|De-aber.ogg|Audio}} ===Conjunction=== {{head|de|conjunction|coordinating}} # [[but]]; [[however]]; [[though]] ====Usage notes==== * Unlike most other conjunctions, ''aber'' need not be the first word of a clause: ''Ich bin dafür, er '''aber''' lehnt es ab.'' — “I’m in favour, '''but''' he rejects it.” In such a construction, ''aber'' might be considered an adverb, though the usual interpretation is that it is still a conjunction. * After a negative, {{m|de|sondern}} is used to express a contrast, while ''aber'' expresses a gradation or nuance. Compare: :: {{ux|de|inline=1|Er ist nicht genial, '''sondern''' dumm.|He isn’t brilliant '''but''' stupid.}} :: {{ux|de|inline=1|Er ist nicht genial, '''aber''' ziemlich klug.|He isn’t brilliant '''but''' quite intelligent.}} ====Derived terms==== * {{l|de|aber hallo}} * {{l|de|aber, aber}} ===Adverb=== {{de-adv}} # {{lb|de|obsolete|except in compounds}} [[again]] # {{lb|de|qualifier}} [[rather]]; [[quite]]; [[unusually]]; {{ngd|used with adjectives to express a surprising degree, whether this surprise be real or for effect}} #: {{usex|de|inline=1|Das ist '''aber''' teuer.|That's '''rather''' expensive. ≈ That's more expensive than I would’ve thought.}} #: {{usex|de|inline=1|Du bist '''aber''' groß geworden!|'''Look how''' tall you’ve become! (''said to a child'')}} # [[nonetheless]], [[nevertheless]] ====Derived terms==== * {{l|de|abermals}} * {{l|de|abertausend}} [[Category:German coordinating conjunctions]] [[Category:German modal particles]] ---- ==Scots== ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|sco|/a(ː)bər/}} ===Adjective=== {{sco-adj}} # {{lb|sco|Shetland}} [[sharp]], [[keen]] # {{lb|sco|Shetland}} [[clear]], [[distinct]] # {{lb|sco|Shetland}} [[sharp]]-[[sight]]ed, [[observant]], [[watchful]] # {{lb|sco|Shetland}} [[eager]] # {{lb|sco|Shetland}} [[greedy]] ===Verb=== {{sco-verb}} # {{lb|sco|Shetland}} to [[sharpen]] # {{lb|sco|Shetland|often with {{l|sco|up}}}} to [[poke]] a [[fire]] in order to [[brighten]] it ===References=== * {{R:ScotsOnline}} ---- ==Serbo-Croatian== ===Alternative forms=== * {{l|sh|hàber}} ===Etymology=== Borrowed from {{bor|sh|ota|خبر|tr=haber}}, from {{der|sh|ar|خَبَر}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|sh|/ǎber/}} * {{hyphenation|sh|a|ber}} ===Noun=== {{sh-noun|g=m|head=àber}} # [[news]] [[information]] # [[message]] # [[sensation]], [[feeling]] ---- ==Swedish== ===Etymology=== Borrowed from {{bor|sv|de|aber||but}}, turned into a noun (as in "no buts and no ifs"). ===Noun=== {{sv-noun|n}} # a [[problem]], an [[obstacle]], a [[difficulty]] ====Declension==== The plural is the same, but definite forms do not apply. ===References=== * {{R:svenska.se|saol}} * {{R:svenska.se|saob}} ===Anagrams=== * {{anagrams|sv|a=aber|bare}} ---- ==Tarifit== ===Alternative forms=== * {{l|rif|ⴰⴱⴻⵔ}} * {{l|rif|abriw}} ===Etymology=== Compare {{cog|shi|abliw}} ===Noun=== {{head|rif|noun|g=m|plural|abriwen|construct state|waber}} #
